name: Xanadu Island Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is promoted as five star, but really it is a very good four star. It has five star facilities, but some puzzling aspects. Self service cafeteria style meals are not quite what it is expected in a five star and the other restaurants had to be booked in advance.
reviews.title: Get away from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were young, friendly but they didn't have the five star attitude of nothing is too much trouble. For example the hotel shuttle had to be booked 24 hours in advance even if there were spare seats on it and it took some pursuading to get on when it was about to leave half empty
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: There was a lot of weird administration for the simplest thing. We arrived and were given cards and told we needed them for pool towels and would be fined 50$ if we lost them. Then no-one asked for them for days, then suddenly you couldn't get a towel without one. A bit bewildering.
reviews.title: Great hotel Especially for babies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked reception to help us reconfirm our flights as we were getting a voicemail message in Turkey - they tried really hard to get us to do it ourselves - not really what I expect from a five star. We got charged for the calls to the incomprehensible voicemail too!
reviews.title: Absolute Luxury

reviews.text: Our room was lovely - in the main block over reception which meant no long walks to and fro at night. . It was huge - although one of the less expensive rooms, an enormous marble bathroom with separate walk in shower and full size tub, two double beds, a sofa, flat screen TV and balcony to sit out on I have had smaller apartments. All beautifully designed and cleaned.
reviews.title: Young management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my wife there to celebrate her 50th Birthday, and It could not have been any better, she absolutely loved it, Its very unfair to pick out the bad points because they are outnumbered 100 to 1 against the good points, so I won't bother, we were very fortunate to get the holiday for the price we paid, so maybe it will prove a bit pricey to return, but that is the only thing that would stop us returning.
reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one week at Xanadu Island last week. Its a really lovely hotel but I am not sure about "high class" and is about one hour from the airport. The hotel is huge with all of the suites overlooking the sea and based around a courtyard. The staff are wonderful, cannot do enough for you and all are extremely friendly. We had a huge room with the largest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel. The hotel is absolutely spotless. It has the most amazing views all the way around the island. The food is plentiful and has a great choice. It is all buffet though, I think it would have been nice to have evening meal as "a la carte" sometimes. We went to the Italian restaurant one night and this was very good. I never saw anybody in the "seafood restaurant", probably because you had a to pay for this. I think they would be better off if they made this part of the all inclusive option. Most 5* hotels will have more than one choice of a restaurant if they are all inclusive and most have many more.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is 15 minutes to the nearest town. They run a shuttle bus there a couple of times a day but they make a charge for this. We missed the shuttle on the day we were going to go there and they said a taxi would be 70 euros return which we thought was a rip off.
reviews.title: fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: A long way from the airport( 1 and a half hours, but worth the trip , we were upgraded to a romance suite which has a round bed , the best hotel bed I have slept in.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel , good value, quiet location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is very good, but the bar staff are too young to drink and are inclined to gossip in groups, a few tips seems to get their attention. The hotel is spotlessly clean and very well managed,(i'am a former 5 star hotel manager) the food is good but a bit boring, they should look at the Mexican hotels, which put on a different cavery every night. We would go back ; yes.
reviews.title: The best disappointment ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a group of 4 couples booked to go to the newly refurbished Bodrum Hilton, only to be told 4 days before flying that the hotel was not finished so we were now booked into Xanadu Island. We arrived at the hotel after a long transfer, to be greeted with the reception staff telling us that they had upgraded our rooms without us asking, and a Rosebud cocktail.
reviews.title: Book it now!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always thought that anyone who went on holiday to then talk about their hotel bathroom really needed to get out more, but the suite we were given was stunning. The whole suite with views was stunning.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The staff were inexperienced, but enthusiastic to please. Trip to the Hong Kong restaurant in Bodrum was special, family boat trip a waste of a day, Turkish bath trip in local town was ok, premium alcohol 24hrs,food was plentiful at buffet, BBQ good, entertainment by animation team was good apart for DJ good to be in a group, some of the external acts not 5 star. Market in Turgutreis is big, buyer beware. Seem to cater more for Northern Europeans , so only news channels in English on 32 inch tv's
reviews.title: absolutely 1st class

description: The Xanadu® Island is a prestigious and exclusive five-star All Suite Hotel at the west coast of Turkey, known for its beautiful olive trees, rocky hills and immense pine forests. It is situated on a private peninsula, amidst beautiful gardens and flowered courtyards and surrounded by the deep blue water of the Aegean Sea.This enchanting and elegant resort belongs to the famous Xanadu chain offering an All Inclusive concept with High Class service. All unique suites and villas are overlooking the sea, beautifully constructed on the cliffs enjoying fabulous views out to the surrounding islands and offering a perfect location for a peaceful and tranquil luxurious holiday.
